status_notes: Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. I met with the general contractor for the project on Winter Street.  I informed him that he needs a dumpster permit for any time he plans on using a dumpster as well as an occupancy permit if he plans on having trucks deliver material to the job site. I informed him that beginning immediately no dumpster can be brought to the work site or any truck deliveries made until he receives the proper permits from the Boston Public Transportation Department and Boston Public Works. He apologized and stated he would comply with my directive and admitted his assumptions about the permitting process were wrong and would apply for the permits Monday. Note: In talking to the Transportation Department, they will not allow any dumpster to be left over night.  That’s why the truck has to be attached to the dumpster so it can be removed immediately after it’s been filled. Also, there will be 2 gas services tomorrow at 31 & 41 Winter Street.  They both have approved permits by the City. We apologize for the inconvenience. For any questions or concerns, please contact the number listed below. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951.

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Noted. Pesticide applications on turf areas are required by state law to be. posted to minimize pesticide exposure to homeowners and the general. public. These yellow warning signs are posted to notify the public. that there has been a recent application of pesticides to the flagged. turf areas. Generally when the pesticide applications are dry then the. risk of exposure is minimal and the signs are then removed. Any turf. pesticide application, including organic ones, are flagged in this. manner. Just because a pesticide is labeled "organic" does not mean. that it is not dangerous or toxic. Generally organic pesticides are. much more expensive, time consuming to apply, and require more. applications than traditional pesticides. The Boston Park Department. works with contractors that practice IPM (Integrated Pest Management). so the least amount of pesticides are used for the desired result. If you have any questions, please contact the Parks Department Horticultural Division at 617-635-7381.  Thank you.
description: Health hazard at Boston Public Garden. City should switch to organic pesticides! Do you know how many babies and pets come here? Unconscionable.

The Inspector told him he had obviously not followed the City's rules when installing the driveway, and if the job was now not completed he would have shut the job down. That going forward if he wants to work in the City he has to get the proper permits, and if he blocks the sidewalk he needs to get sidewalk closed signs. He apologized and said he would. status_notes: Case Noted. Good day Ms. Lauerhass. I am Sgt. John Dougherty with the Boston PD in District E-13, Jamaica Plain. We have received your request for service regarding loud music on Sunday night. . 911 did receive 2 requests for service on Mozart St. through the Citywide Party Line. A police unit was dispatched to the area at 10:06PM and that unit arrived on scene a short time later. The call was cleared at 12:03AM by the responding unit following their investigation. . . If this situation, (or any others) might become a Quality of Life concern in the future, please call 911 as soon as possible. This is the best way to ensure and document the call for service. You may remain anonymous if you wish. It is helpful if you can give as much information as possible including the source and type of problem as well as any description of parties involved. It is also helpful, (but not required), if you are able to speak to the responding officers. If you have any questions or concerns about the police response or other issues, please call our office at your convenience. We are glad to help. . Thank you for your time and consideration. Respectfully,. -- . Sgt. John Dougherty. BPD District E-13 Community Service Supervisor. 3347 Washington Street. Jamaica Plain MA 02130. C.S.O. Office. - 617-343-5623. E-13 Main       - 617-343-5630.

description: Illegal commercial signage in residential zoning sub district. The property owner is an absentee investor who poorly manages overdeveloped property. This is not a for sale sign so what is it other than advertising? Quality investment that enhances quality of life for long term residents is needed, not speculative out of character schemes that benefit investors who don't have to live without their poor contributions to the urban fabric.

status_notes: Duplicate of Existing Case. see case 101001897315.
description:
This construction site is now putting scaffolding over our door.  Please do something about these guys.  It's insane how disrespectful and inconsiderate they are.  No communication, concrete stuff spilled on our property, waking us up with this construction at 6:15a.

Is this what Boston living is about?  Where are the rules and enforcement?  What's the point of the rules if they're not getting enforced?  Why is this entity being given special consideration by the city and allowed to disturb the peace, damage property, and generally be a neighborhood menace?  I know that my neighbors have all reported issues many times with evidence - over the past two years at least!  Please do something about this.
